What is the purpose of the `getidentitycontent` command in Verus?

The `getidentitycontent` command is used to retrieve content associated with a specific identity on the Verus network. It can be used to fetch content from a specific height range, with optional parameters to include transaction proofs, search for specific content using a VDXF key, and even return deleted items.

getidentitycontent "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight) (vdxfkey) (keepdeleted)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,
                                inclusive. -1 means also return values from the mempool.
  "txproofs"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof
  "vdxfkey"              (vdxf key, optional) default=null, more selective search for specific content in ID
  "keepdeleted"            (bool, optional) default=false, if true, return deleted items as well

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentitycontent "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitycontent", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How do I use the `getidentitycontent` command to retrieve content from a specific identity?

To use the `getidentitycontent` command, you need to provide the identity's name followed by "@" or its i-address as a string. You can also specify optional parameters such as `heightstart` and `heightend` to limit the content retrieval to a specific height range. Additionally, you can include `txproofs` to return proof of the identity, `txproofheight` to specify the height from which to generate the proof, `vdxfkey` for a more selective search, and `keepdeleted` to return deleted items as well.

getidentitycontent "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight) (vdxfkey) (keepdeleted)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,
                                inclusive. -1 means also return values from the mempool.
  "txproofs"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof
  "vdxfkey"              (vdxf key, optional) default=null, more selective search for specific content in ID
  "keepdeleted"            (bool, optional) default=false, if true, return deleted items as well

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentitycontent "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitycontent", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What is the default behavior of the `heightstart` and `heightend` parameters in the `getidentitycontent` command?

By default, `heightstart` is set to 0, meaning that the command will return content from the genesis block (height 0) forward, inclusive. `heightend` is set to 0 by default, which means the command will return content up to the current maximum height. If `heightend` is set to -1, the command will also return values from the mempool.

getidentitycontent "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight) (vdxfkey) (keepdeleted)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,
                                inclusive. -1 means also return values from the mempool.
  "txproofs"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof
  "vdxfkey"              (vdxf key, optional) default=null, more selective search for specific content in ID
  "keepdeleted"            (bool, optional) default=false, if true, return deleted items as well

Result:

> verus getidentitycontent "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitycontent", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I use the `getidentitycontent` command to retrieve proof of an identity?

To retrieve proof of an identity using the `getidentitycontent` command, you need to set the `txproofs` parameter to `true`. You can also specify the `txproofheight` parameter to generate the proof from a specific height.

getidentitycontent "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight) (vdxfkey) (keepdeleted)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,

  "keepdeleted"            (bool, optional) default=false, if true, return deleted items as well
